metadata.title: CVE-2022-48756 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/msm/dsi: invalid parameter check in msm_dsi_phy_enable The functionperforms a check on the "phy" input parameter, however, it is used beforethe check. Initialize the "dev" variable after the sanity check to avoid apossible NULL pointer dereference. Addresses-Coverity-ID: 1493860 ("Nullpointer dereference")

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48756` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-176-generic - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-176-generic - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-176-lowlatency - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-aws - 4.15.0-1127.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1137-azure - 4.15.0-1137.150~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-gcp - 4.15.0-1121.135~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1092-oracle - 4.15.0-1092.101~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.136~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1137.150~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.135~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1092.101~16.04.1').
